socialSecurityDeathIndex

Class TimeSpan

  • java.lang.Object
    • socialSecurityDeathIndex.TimeSpan

  • public class TimeSpan
extends java.lang.Object
    A time interval, specified via starting and ending Date date/timestamps.
    The TimeSpan class enables the specification of birth/death dates that are uncertain in day-of-month (or similar uncertainties).
    Author:
    vlcek

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int SECONDS_PER_DAY
      The number of seconds in a day

        See Also:

    • Constructor Detail

      • TimeSpan

        public TimeSpan(java.lang.String sSpan)
         throws java.lang.NumberFormatException
        Create a TimeSpan object from a properly-formatted date string. The precise format of the date string is that used in the Social Security Death Index master file.
        Parameters:
        sSpan - a string representation of the time span, in the format MMDDYYYY
        Throws:
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - if the month, date or year in sSpan are not valid string representations of integer values

      • TimeSpan

        public TimeSpan()
        Construct a time span with the default zero-length duration. The returned object has starting and ending times equal to the current time (at which the object is created).

      • TimeSpan

        public TimeSpan(java.util.Date start,
        java.util.Date end)
        Construct a time span with specified starting and ending points
        Parameters:
        start - the earliest date/time in the TimeSpan
        end - the latest date/time in the TimeSpan

    • Method Detail

      • getStart

        public java.util.Date getStart()
        Gets the beginning of the TimeSpan
        Returns:
        the earliest date/time date/time in the TimeSpan

      • getEnd

        public java.util.Date getEnd()
        Gets the end of the TimeSpan
        Returns:
        the latest date/time date/time in the TimeSpan

      • getDurationInSeconds

        public long getDurationInSeconds()
        Gets the duration of the TimeSpan
        Returns:
        the time interval (in seconds) between getStart() and getEnd()

      • getDurationInDays

        public long getDurationInDays()
        Gets the duration of the TimeSpan
        Returns:
        the time interval (in whole days) between getStart() and getEnd()
